data.title: The best cajun/creole food
data.text: We've eaten here several times and I highly recommend it to anyone looking to eat in Decatur. We've eaten here as a family. We had our rehearsal dinner here with a large group of people. The ownership is on point, the staff is friendly and the food is amazing.

data.title: Terrible All Around
data.text: We are regulars downtown Decatur and decided to try the new restaurant for an early dinner. The place was empty and was not inviting at all. The waitress did not speak good English and the owner was sitting at a table and continued to crack jokes and yell at her. I ordered the shrimp pasta and it was not good at all. We have not and will not be back.

data.title: Open, delicious and I will be a regular!
data.text:
This was my first visit to The Big Easy, but it will be the first of MANY! It is a short drive (about 30 minutes) and well worth it! 
In historic downtown Decatur, a beautiful place to walk or enjoy 3rd Friday celebrations during the summer months. The Big Easy has genuine Louisiana Dishes and the best sweet tea anywhere! 

I had the grilled shrimp, sweet potato fries and green beans. All were served at the appropriate temperature and seasoned to perfection.

The restaurant was clean and decorated in traditional New Orleans style. Prices are very reasonable and the service I received was excellent.

They have a full bar, plenty of tables with comfortable chairs and welcome families with children. 

I hope you will enjoy every trip to The Big Easy as much as I did this one!!

data.title: Wish I could report better - restaurant now closed
data.text:
I really want to like this place. I really want good red beans and rice in a Decatur restaurant. But I have tried their dish both in the restaurant and in a styrofoam cup from their food truck, and it is NOT good.
Restaurant - nice place, but Saturday lunch was quite expensive, and this is for a bowl of red beans and rice with just a few pieces of sausage. No roll or bread. No salad. Extremely slow service, and the place was not crowded at all. 

THe restaurant is currently closed while the owners concentrate on their new location in Falkville. They say they'll reopen, but I'd be surprised if they did.

owner_response.author: DLB395, Manager at The Big Easy, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are open we only closed for a brief time to install a bar, we are sorry that you do not like our red beans & rice, we do not have too many complaints over them. Maybe we could offer you another item off of our all new menu, just identify your self to management when you come in and we will make things right for you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wish it were closer!
data.text: Several visits to this location and also in their previous location in Athens. Owner is longtime friend and I was excited when he first Opened several years ago. We try to time our visits to Decatur during lunch hours. Always a great meal.

data.title: Pleasantly Surprised
data.text: I never even knew this place existed until my girlfriend said she wanted to go.  There is hardly anything online about it,  and no online dinner menu anywhere I could find. But we went and it was really nice!  I had a whiskey sour, and my friend had a mohito and we had seafood stuffed mushrooms as our appetizer. No complaints - very tasty!  For dinner she had the fried alligator,  fried green tomatoes,  and pasta salad. She said her meal was delicious!  I had the fried oysters,  the onion straws, and  coleslaw.  Mine was delicious and fresh.  I felt the menu had unique selections and reasonable prices.  We had chocolate cobbler for dessert and it was to die for. I hope this little gem in the heart of downtown Decatur makes it,  but they could really use a good web designer.  Go ahead and go- I really don't think you'll be disappointed!

data.title: Very disappointed especially after reading great reviews!!!
data.text:
Today my family of three went to this restaurant after reading the reviews   and seeing a menu we were excited to go. This was our first visit and I can't say how VERY DISAPPOINTED  in this restaurant! We originally went in for alligator but was not available at lunch and was actually one of the reasons we chose there. But we tried to make the best of it and it was all down hill from there. We have a young child and asked for a child's menu as the choices were not listed on the lunch menu. The waitress never could locate one and eventually came back with register tape with the choices written down. Prices of kids meals were not written down so we didn't know how much it really was until the bill came. My spouse and myself ordered the 3 combo. 3in sandwich, soup and bread. For my son, chicken tenders.

It took 20 minuets for the food to come out, which was for me a bit slow since there was only two other tables of 2 there and they had already been served. The chicken was battered nicely but was INSIPID!!! 

Our meals, the 3 combo. Only 2/3s of it was delivered. Our bread was missing. It took over 5 minuets to wave a waitress down, to let her know to send our waitress. She then brought our bread. I have to say great taste for the gumbo and jambalaya. 

Our sandwiches were even more disappointing as our sandwiches had OLD, WATERY, BROKEN DOWN, that looked more like cooked spinach then lettuce, mixed with newer lettuce. 

I try to give restaurants the benefit of the doubt and a couple of tries but I can't say if I will give this another try as the rotten lettuce really put me on the fence post.

owner_response.author: DLB395, Manager at The Big Easy, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are very sorry for the bad experience you had we strive to do better every day, we would like to extend to you a 15% discount to get you to come back in and try our all new menu, the alligator is available all day now. We would also ask you to reconsider giving us a better rating, we look forward to hearing from you and making your experience a great one.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pleasantly surprised!
data.text: I am not usually a "Meat and 3" type, but I was pleasantly surprised by a recent trip to The Big Easy for lunch.  The food was served promptly, well seasoned, and very flavorful!  I was a little bummed to later discover that they only serve the dinner menu on weekends (nearly all seafood, which I cannot eat) and the lunch menu is only available during the week :(  Oh, well..... Weekday lunch it is!

data.title: Surprisingly creative
data.text: We've been here twice.   Everything we've tried has been spectacular, but the crawfish cakes are at the top of the list.  Probably as good as anything I've ever had.   Other highlights are the praline sweet potatoes and boudin balls.

data.title: Nice new place to frequent on return trips
data.text:
One of my colleagues who lives in Madison, AL recommended this for our group. There were 15 of us and service was not an issue with a large party. 

We shared many appetizers which included raw oysters, shoe string onions, hush puppies, fried green tomatoes, frogs' legs, sweet potato casserole and alligator bites. The entrees were of good size. I had the red snapper Ponchatrain which I would recommend. They were out of soft shell crabs, which was a disappointment. 

We got 4 bread puddings for dessert. Not a fan of bread pudding, this was exceptional. They don't have a full liquor license yet, but an excellent selection of beers. As stated, service was great.

data.title: Good New Orlean's Style Food in Old Town Decatur
data.text: Happened up on Che Big Easy looking for something different and fun for lunch in old town Decatur, and were pleasantly surprised.  Let me say first off, we will be back, either for lunch or supper.  This is a small boutique type restaurant where the food and the atmosphere match the name.  The food was great, spot on for Louisiana and New Orleans style cooking.  (For example, they make their own Boudin sausage.) Prices are very reasonable and service very good.  By the way, the renewal of old town Decatur is really moving along and is another reason to go have a bite at Che Big Easy.
